Package com.miage.vehicle_sales_management.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.miage.vehicle_sales_management.controller.UserController
@Controller @SessionAttributes("user") public class UserController extends Object
Controller related to the user

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView
    login(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
    Show the login page of the website
    org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView
    loginCheck(String email, String password, org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
    Check the user's credentials If the credentials are correct, the user is redirected to the page catalog.jsp If the credentials are incorrect or user does not exist in the database, the page login.jsp is displayed again with an error message
    org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView
    logout(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv, org.springframework.web.bind.support.SessionStatus status)
    Disconnect the user and redirect to the page login.jsp
    org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView
    register(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
    Show the register page of the website
    org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView
    registerCheck(String lastName, String firstName, String type, String email, String password, String country, org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
    Register a new user and check if the email is already used If the registration is successful, the user is redirected to the page catalog.jsp If the registration is unsuccessful, the page register.jsp is displayed again with an error message

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • login

      @RequestMapping(value="/login", method={GET,POST}) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView login(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
      Show the login page of the website
      Parameters:
      mv - ModelAndView of the page
      Returns:
      mv ModelAndView with the page login.jsp

    • loginCheck

      @RequestMapping(value="/login-check", method=POST) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView loginCheck(@RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password, org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Check the user's credentials If the credentials are correct, the user is redirected to the page catalog.jsp If the credentials are incorrect or user does not exist in the database, the page login.jsp is displayed again with an error message
      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      mv - ModelAndView of the page
      Returns:
      mv ModelAndView with the page catalog.jsp or login.jsp
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • register

      @RequestMapping(value="/register", method={GET,POST}) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView register(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv)
      Show the register page of the website
      Parameters:
      mv - ModelAndView of the page
      Returns:
      mv ModelAndView with the page register.jsp

    • registerCheck

      @RequestMapping(value="/register-check", method=POST) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView registerCheck(@RequestParam("lastName") String lastName, @RequestParam("firstName") String firstName, @RequestParam("type") String type, @RequestParam("email") String email, @RequestParam("password") String password, @RequestParam("country") String country, org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Register a new user and check if the email is already used If the registration is successful, the user is redirected to the page catalog.jsp If the registration is unsuccessful, the page register.jsp is displayed again with an error message
      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      mv - ModelAndView of the page
      Returns:
      mv ModelAndView with the page catalog.jsp or register.jsp
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • logout

      @RequestMapping(value="/logout", method=POST) public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView logout(org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView mv, org.springframework.web.bind.support.SessionStatus status)
      Disconnect the user and redirect to the page login.jsp
      Parameters:
      mv - ModelAndView of the page
      status - SessionStatus of the user
      Returns:
      mv ModelAndView with the page login.jsp
